description: A key regulator of the inflammatory response that mediates various cellular responses.
One of the two receptors that TNF interacts with, involved in distinct and overlapping signal transduction pathways.
The second receptor that TNF interacts with, which initiates different signal transduction pathways.
An autoimmune disorder that primarily affects joints, causing inflammation and pain.
A type of arthritis that causes inflammation of the spine and the joints.
A group of inflammatory conditions of the colon and small intestine.
A chronic autoimmune condition that causes rapid skin cell production leading to scaling on the skin's surface.
